subject: Science
title: Vestigial Structures
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Vestigial Structures.

hook.text: Your body contains parts that no longer serve any purpose. They're leftovers from evolution.

buildup.text: The human appendix, wisdom teeth, and tailbone are vestiges of ancestral forms.

discovery.text: Whales have tiny hidden leg bones inside their bodies â€” remnants of when they walked on land.

twist.text: Flightless birds like ostriches still have wing bones â€” too small to fly but still present.

climax.text: These structures only make sense if species evolved from ancestors that used them.

punchline.text: Whales have hidden legs. You have a tail. Evolution leaves its old parts behind.

quiz.question: What are vestigial structures?
options: Body parts inherited from ancestors that no longer function
Newly evolving features not yet useful
Organs that work differently in each species
